name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoic acid has a melting point of 122-123 °C. The addition of a methyl group to the carboxylic acid to form an ester will increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the loss of hydrogen bonding ability. The methyl group is estimated to increase the melting point by about +5 °C.
